Curriculum Overview

Agentic AI Security Professional (CAASP)

120-hour modular program

17%
1 / 6

This module establishes the technical and conceptual foundation required to understand agentic AI systems and their security implications.

Coverage
  • â¢ Large Language Models (LLMs), Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), and autonomous agents
  • â¢ Agent architectures and core attack surfaces
  • â¢ STRIDE-GPT methodology for AI threat modeling
  • â¢ Introduction to MITRE ATLAS for adversarial AI techniques

This module focuses on real-world attack techniques targeting autonomous and goal-driven AI agents.

Coverage
  • â¢ Memory poisoning in agentic systems
  • â¢ Tool misuse and privilege escalation via agent actions
  • â¢ Goal and authorization hijacking attacks
  • â¢ Cascading failures across interconnected agents
  • â¢ RAG poisoning and agentic AI supply chain attacks

This module addresses security challenges unique to multi-agent and distributed AI ecosystems.

Coverage
  • â¢ Inter-agent communication security and poisoning attacks
  • â¢ Emergent behavioral vulnerabilities in multi-agent environments
  • â¢ Agent impersonation, collusion, and coordinated malicious behavior
  • â¢ Governance and accountability models for multi-agent systems

This module covers securing real-world AI applications and agent integrations at scale.

Coverage
  • â¢ API and tool integration security for agentic systems
  • â¢ RAG pipeline security and exploitation techniques
  • â¢ Agent sandboxing, isolation, and resource control mechanisms
  • â¢ Privacy risks and autonomous data handling
  • â¢ Incident response and forensic considerations for autonomous systems

This module focuses on regulatory, governance, and risk frameworks for deploying autonomous AI systems responsibly.

Coverage
  • â¢ ISO/IEC 42001 for agentic AI deployments
  • â¢ NIST AI Risk Management Framework (AI RMF)
  • â¢ EU AI Act implications for high-risk autonomous systems
  • â¢ Governance design for autonomous workflows and decision-making

This module provides offensive security techniques to evaluate and harden agentic AI systems.

Coverage
  • â¢ Red team methodologies for AI and agentic systems
  • â¢ Prompt and toolchain exploitation techniques
  • â¢ Multi-agent red teaming scenarios
  • â¢ Automated adversarial testing for agentic AI environments
CAPSTONE PROJECT

Design, attack, and secure an agentic AI system

Learners complete a full end-to-end security assessment of a real-world autonomous AI deployment.

Scenario Context

Autonomous AI agents supporting financial analysis and decision workflows.

What You Will Build
  • Agentic workflows for financial data processing
  • Tool integrations for analysis and reporting
What You Will Break
  • Memory and RAG poisoning attacks
  • Tool misuse and privilege escalation
  • Cascading agent decision failures
What You Will Secure
  • Guardrails for financial decision autonomy
  • Monitoring and incident response for agent actions

This capstone demonstrates real-world readiness for securing autonomous AI systems.
